Welcome to my page! I am Mohammad Imrul Jubair. I completed my MSc in Computer Science from the University of Calgary, Canada under the supervision of Dr. Usman R. Alim. I worked as a research assistant in Visualization and Graphics Group (VISAGG) at Graphics Jungle Lab. I completed my BSc in Computer Science and Information Technology from the Islamic University of Technology, Dhaka. I also worked as a teaching assistant at University of Calgary from Fall 2014 to Fall 2016. Currently, I am working as a faculty member in Computer Science and Engineering at Ahasanullah University of Science and Technology, Bangladesh.

Research

I have interest in Visualization, Graphics and Computer Vision. In my MSc research, I collaborated with the German Climate Computing Centre (DKRZ) and developed a technique called "Icosahedral Maps" for efficient multiresolution visualization of climate model, i.e. ICON (Icosahedral Nonhydrostatic) model.


I also have interest in Image Processing and Computer Vision since my undergrad. I worked on noise removal, book region detection and character recognition.


Selected publications:

  1. Jubair M. I., “Icosahedral Maps for a Multiresolution Representation of Earth Data”, MSc thesis, Department of Computer Science, University of Calgary, 2017. [slides]

  2. Jubair M. I., Alim U., Röber N., Clyne J. & Mahdavi-Amiri A., “Icosahedral Maps for a Multiresolution Representation of Earth Data”, VMV 2016. [paper]

  3. Jubair M. I., Alim U., Röber N., Clyne J., Mahdavi-Amiri A. & Samavati. F., “Multiresolution Visualization of Digital Earth Data via Hexagonal Box Spline Wavelets”, IEEE VIS 2015. [paper] [poster]

  4. Jubair M. I. & Banik P., “A Technique to Detect Books from Library Bookshelf Image”, IEEE 9th International Conference on Computational Cybernetics, Hungary, 2013. [paper] [code]

Visit my Google Scholar page.
